symptoms.name: Pelvic inflammatory disease symptoms
symptoms.pattern: Can range from mild to severe

symptoms.name: Secondary syphilis rash
symptoms.pattern: Generalized rash, often macular or papular

physical_findings: Secondary syphilis rash (macular, papular, or pustular)

imaging_findings.Ultrasound: Possible findings consistent with pelvic inflammatory disease (e.g., thickened endometrium, fluid in cul-de-sac)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with secondary syphilis and pelvic inflammatory disease
Reactive serological tests for syphilis (RPR/VDRL, FTA-ABS/TPPA)
supportive: Positive dark-field microscopy or PCR for Treponema pallidum

differential_diagnoses: Other causes of pelvic inflammatory disease (e.g., gonorrhea, chlamydia)
Other causes of rash (e.g., drug reactions, viral exanthems)
